body_content.explanation: to recognize how good someone or something is and to value them or it:
examples: There's no point buying him expensive wines - he doesn't appreciate them.
Any help you could give me would be greatly appreciated.
His visits were much appreciated by the boys.

body_content.explanation: to understand a situation and realize that it is important:
examples: We appreciate the need for immediate action.
I appreciate that it's a difficult decision for you to make.
I don't think you appreciate how much time I spent preparing this meal.

body_content.explanation: used when you are thanking someone or showing that you are grateful:
examples: We really appreciate all the help you gave us last weekend.
I appreciate your making the effort to come.
We sincerely appreciate the feedback you have given us.
I received your kind letter and I really appreciate it.
I'm feeling much better now, but I appreciate your concern.
She really appreciated his offers of help.

body_content.explanation: used when you are politely asking for something:
examples: I would appreciate it if you could let me know (= please let me know) in advance whether or not you will be coming.
The value of our house has appreciated by 50 percent in the last two years.
Our house has appreciated in value over the last two years.
